comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [Edited] The original glass negative - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2633070834/ or Zoomify at from.ph/379087 . Strangely this print is taller and narrower than the original negative. Photo taken at 12:20 on 13 August 1901. It was a Tuesday.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: This photograph sure got around. The State Library of Victoria have a print too.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: See J. J. Hilder's watercolour Frog Hollow, The Rocks, Sydney (1910) in 'The Heritage of J. J. Hilder' by Brett Hilder (Sydney : Ure Smith, 1966), pp. 52-53. In 1965 this was in a private collection in NSW, but the National Gallery of Victoria and the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery also have versions of this work, executed 1910 and 1912 respectively. Alas none online ...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence) AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Photographer John Degotardi Jnr was on top of the 'Harts Pub' (as now is).  Hence the unusual height.
